column1: 134F9118-B567-43B3-9EB1-A3EA701AE7D7#appfire#C0EEF6A6-7DD0-4C84-8FEC-C8C09D57E37E#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-21 06:35:28#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-21 06:35:28#appfire#1

ABD9FAFE-D6E3-49BF-95B2-D0F9993A3380#appfire#C0EEF6A6-7DD0-4C84-8FEC-C8C09D57E37E#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-21 06:35:28#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-21 06:35:28#appfire#1
